title: Eastern Cape health department an embarrassment, says outgoing health ombud
short_description: Outgoing health ombud Professor Malegapuru Makgoba, has described the Eastern Cape health department as embarrassing.
Makgoba, who was in office for seven years, was reflecting on his term as the first health ombud.

title: WATCH | Parents identify bodies of 5 pupils killed in horror Cape Town crash
short_description: Parents of the five pupils who were killed in a horrific crash on AZ Berman Drive in Beacon Valley on Tuesday had the daunting task of identifying their children's bodies at the Observatory Forensic Pathology Institute on Wednesday morning.
The Toyota Hilux bakkie, in which the children were travelling, allegedly hit the pavement, before crashing into a traffic light along AZ Berman Drive.The pupils were flung from the vehicle.

title: DEVELOPING | Cops, NPA slam Magudumana's Tanzanian abduction claims as 'utterly untruthful'
MUT calls on public to help find lecturer allegedly kidnapped in Durban
short_description: Top brass at the Mangosuthu University of Technology (MUT) has pleaded for the safe return of one of their lecturers who was allegedly kidnapped on Sunday.
Shan Dwarika, 61, an electrical engineering lecturer, was allegedly snatched outside the home he rents in Sea Cow Lake, Durban.

title: Do you have any complaints or feedback about News24's content? Here's how to get in touch
short_description: Seasoned journalist and academic Professor George Claassen is the public editor of News24.
Claassen has served as a board member of the International Organisation of News Ombudsmen and Readers' Editors since 2011.

title: Cholera outbreak: Downward trend of infections observed in Tshwane - Joe Phaahla
short_description: While the source of the cholera outbreak in Hammanskraal, Tshwane, has not yet been identified, there has been a downward trend in infections and serious illnesses.
This according to Health Minister Dr Joe Phaahla, who gave an update on the outbreak on Wednesday afternoon.

title: We don't owe R102m, this is fraud, says Fikile Mbalula on ANC asset attachment order
short_description: ANC secretary-general Fikile Mbalula says the ANC does not owe R102 million to a KwaZulu-Natal branding company for election material despite a court-issued sheriff's order attaching the party's assets to recoup the funds.
He said the ANC planned to open a criminal case.

title: Western Cape murders decrease, but multiple murders remain a concern
short_description: The Western Cape has seen a 14% year-on-year decrease in murders between January and March.
During a briefing to unpack the most recent quarterly crime statistics, provincial police said there had been a decrease in murders in almost all districts.

title: Three suspects arrested for shepherd's murder, theft of 98 sheep on Free State farm
short_description: Three men who allegedly shot dead a shepherd on a Free State farm and stole 98 sheep worth R270 000 have been arrested in Gauteng.

Free State police spokesperson, Sergeant Mahlomola Kareli, said the 33-year-old man - who was later identified as Hlompho Patrick Phale - was found with his hands bound and with a gunshot wound to the stomach.

title: Durban 'Woolies looter' will have to wait until July for sentencing
short_description: The sentencing of "Woolies looter" Mbuso Moloi, who was caught stealing goods from a Woolworths store during the July 2021 unrest, has been postponed until 7 July.
The 31-year-old Moloi briefly appeared in the Durban Magistrate’s Court on Wednesday, where sentencing proceedings were expected to be finalised.

title: More than 80 operations cancelled in Gauteng hospitals due to clean linen shortage
short_description: About 81 operations had to be cancelled in hospitals in Gauteng due to a shortage of clean linen.
Gauteng Health MEC Nomantu Nkomo-Ralehoko revealed this on Wednesday in a written reply to questions from the DA's Jack Bloom

title: Mawela promises to act against officers who allegedly failed to assist family of slain pupil
short_description: Gauteng police commissioner Lieutenant General Elias Mawela has warned that he will take action against police officers who failed to help the family of slain Soshanguve pupil, Palesa Malatji.
This comes after the Malatji family alleged that Rietgat police did not help them when they wanted to open a missing persons case.

title: DEVELOPING | #LadyRussiagate: Could Ramaphosa's peace mission to Ukraine be his saving grace if...
ANC councillor accused of killing comrade to be removed from eThekwini council
short_description: eThekwini Municipality Speaker Thabani Nyawose has recommended that the ANC's Mzimuni Ngiba be removed from council as he has been in jail for more than a year for the alleged murder of his comrade and predecessor, Nkosinathi Ngcobo.
It emerged in council recently that Ngiba had still been receiving a full salary while in jail for more than a year. He is awaiting trial.

title: Only ActionSA, ANC and DA declared donations between January and March
short_description: ActionSA had the most reason to laugh all the way to the bank between January and March, as it was the party that declared the largest amount of donations to the Electoral Commission of South Africa (IEC).
The party, along with the ANC and DA, declared donations totalling just under R6 million for the period between January and March, the fourth quarter of the 2022–2023 financial year.

title: LIVE | Presidency budget vote: 'National blackout highly improbable' - Electricity Minister...
Ace Magashule faces expulsion from ANC after having 'illegally suspended' Cyril Ramaphosa
short_description: Former ANC secretary-general Ace Magashule has been found guilty of contravening the party's constitution when he attempted to suspend Cyril Ramaphosa in 2021.
The ANC national disciplinary committee (NDC) recommended that Magashule be expelled from the party for his behaviour.

title: Taxi guard shot dead at rank near Blackheath Primary School
short_description: A 27-year-old man was shot dead during peak-hour traffic at a Kuilsriver taxi rank in Cape Town on Wednesday morning.
It is suspected that the man was shot during a taxi-related turf war.
